critique: The document is an executive order from 1917 authorizing the suspension of the eight-hour workday law for Department of Agriculture contractors for 30 days due to a national emergency. This was during World War I. It relates to the distribution of seeds. It does not directly address ideological tilt, immigration, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, or social inclusion. It does expand executive power temporarily and involves government intervention in labor regulations during an emergency.
